meanings.definition: To turn over quickly or suddenly
meanings.sent1: She flipped the pancake in the air.
meanings.sent2: He flipped the light switch to turn off the room.
meanings.sent3: The cat flipped the toy mouse around playfully.
meanings.sent4: The sudden gust of wind flipped the umbrella inside out.
meanings.sent5: The gymnast flipped gracefully on the balance beam.

meanings.sent1: The car flipped a sharp turn on the road.
meanings.sent2: The wind flipped the direction of the flag.
meanings.sent3: The compass needle flipped back and forth confusingly.
meanings.sent4: Her mood flipped from happy to sad in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The bird flipped in mid-air to avoid a collision.

meanings.sent1: He flipped out when he saw the mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: She flipped at the rude comment made by her coworker.
meanings.sent3: The toddler flipped when his toy was taken away.
meanings.sent4: The teacher flipped over the student's disrespectful behavior.
meanings.sent5: The dog flipped out when the doorbell rang.

meanings.definition: To buy and sell quickly for profit
meanings.sent1: Investors flipped stocks for a quick gain.
meanings.sent2: She flipped vintage items for a profit online.
meanings.sent3: The trader flipped currencies to make money.
meanings.sent4: He flipped houses in the real estate market.
meanings.sent5: The entrepreneur flipped products at a flea market.
